seniority_level.evidence: Job posting and extraction provide no years of experience or seniority keywords.

job_family.evidence: Title is "Data Engineer" and responsibilities focus on data pipelines and SQL.

sub_specialty.evidence: Databricks and SQL are mentioned without any streaming or real‑time keywords, indicating batch ETL work.

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of people‑management, team lead, or technical lead responsibilities.

primary_cloud.evidence: Databricks is referenced but no specific cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP) is named.

secondary_clouds.evidence: No additional cloud providers are mentioned in the posting.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Only batch‑oriented tools (Databricks, SQL) are listed; no streaming technologies are cited.

orchestrator_category.evidence: No orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, etc.) appear in the description.

storage_layer.evidence: The posting does not specify a data warehouse, lake, or lakehouse technology.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location restriction is "Toronto, Ontario, Canada" with a hybrid work model.

timezone_focus.evidence: Toronto operates in the Eastern Time zone, part of the Americas region.

relocation_required.evidence: No relocation language is present; the role is hybrid and expects the candidate to be based in Toronto.

h1b_friendly.evidence: Visa sponsorship is marked as "not_mentioned" and the role is Canada‑based.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of OPT/CPT eligibility; work authorization is implied for Canadian candidates.

citizenship_required.evidence: Only a location restriction is given; no citizenship clause appears.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Contract type is listed as "fixed_term" with no indication of employment classification (W2, C2C, 1099).

benefits_level.evidence: The extraction shows an empty benefits list and no equity, PTO, or other perks are described.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: The posting does not discuss career progression, ladders, or growth opportunities.

mentorship_signals.evidence: No reference to mentorship programs or senior staff guidance is provided.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No language about promotions or advancement appears in the description.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: The job ad does not mention internal transfers or mobility options.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No career track (IC, management, specialist, architect) is referenced.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Three must‑have hard skills are listed (Databricks, SQL, Audit) with no nice‑to‑have items, indicating a balanced requirement set.

scope_definition.evidence: The description is concise and focuses solely on a Data Engineer role with specific technology and domain needs.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Required skills are reasonable for a Data Engineer; no excessive senior‑level expectations are present.
